name: Adrenal
text: This effect lasts ueoc.

name: Ammo.*
text: This can be used by a related Loaded item. It is Consumed.

name: Animate vine
text: This counts as a monster with base stats of 8-average, +1 size, +5 combat, a Net attack, and Sessile and Unseeing. It's typically aggressive against anything nearby.

name: Aquatic
text: This thrives in water rather than on land. +5 to physical checks while in water, -10 while out.

name: Bleeding
text: (condition) Each round, take 1 point of Fatigue aeor. Resolve this aeoc or when you reach 10 Fatigue. Medical: Check MET+knowledge vs 15; on a pass, resolve this.

name: Channelled
text: You must constantly cast this spell to maintain its effect. The effect stops if you pick something up, are incapacitated, or cast another spell. You can move around, act, and fight unarmed.

name: Civilian
text: No mechanical effect, but it is assumed that player characters won't have much use for this.

name: Combat
text: This gives a numerical or other bonus to combat.

name: Concealed
text: You can easily hide this under your clothes.

name: Condition
text: This has a maximum of 10 tokens at a time.

name: Consumed
text: Single use.

name: Cornucopic
text: This produces a tremendous amount of food. Cornucopics are illegal under Hebai's Law.

name: Crit
text: This inflicts double damage. Multiple crits do not stack.

name: Dominate
text: Take control of the target. You don't control them directly and don't gain a telepathic link, but it will try to obey commands, protect you, and attack your enemies. Even if it doesn't understand your language, it can intuit general intent. If two characters both try to take control of the same target, they check MAS+magic against each other; the loser fails and loses access to whatever method they tried until their next long rest, and if the winner had already dominated the target, the loser also loses focus as per a POW roll.

name: Dubious
text: I'm not convinced this content is really a good idea, at least in its current form, but I'll include it for now and playtest, rethink, and revise.

name: Facile
text: You can cast this spell even if not attuned to its colour.

name: Fiery
text: When this inflicts damage, it is in the form of Burn, not Injury. This has Light $POW.

name: Fight style
text: You may only have one boon with this; and that boon only applies if you have no Armour.

name: Incapacitated
text: (condition) You can't do anything. Lasts until end of battle.

name: Indirect
text: Enemies don't gain a combat bonus against you if they're behind cover.

name: Innocent
text: NPCs don't interpret this as a weapon.

name: Loaded.*
text: This can only operate by expending ammunition of the listed type.

name: Long rest
text: You get one of these per session or mission, whichever takes longer: no taking multiple long rests by taking a month-long hike, no taking multiple if you spend ages in the same dungeon.

name: Medical
text: Other characters may do this move on your behalf. You take the penalty for failure regardless.

name: Modifier
text: This ability may (optionally) be used in conjunction with an action to change its rules. You may stack arbitrarily many modifiers.

name: Move
text: This is an action that otherwise isn't available.

name: Net
text: On a hit against an opponent without Tangle, this inflicts Tangle n instead of n damage.

name: Persistent
text: This spell effect continues for some time even after you stop casting.

name: Prereq.*
text: You can't take this without the listed prerequisite. If you do somehow get it without the prerequisite, it doesn't take effect.

name: Ranged
text: This applies only when engaging from outside melee. You may have both a ranged and a non-ranged weapon equipped at once in the same hand slots.

name: Restrain
text: When you hit a target with this, instead of taking damage they become Restrained: they are immobilised and take -3 to all physical actions. To maintain this, you must stay within melee range. The target can break this by successfully hitting you, and you may release at any time (modifier).

name: Sessile
text: This can't manoeuvre around the battlefield. It can still move eg to engage in combat, as opposed to something fully paralysed.

name: Sharp
text: When you incapacitate with this, the target takes Bleeding.

name: Slow
text: This can't be used during Crisis, the idea being that it takes a while and is at least a little fiddly.

name: Social
text: No mechanical effect, but if ever I create a social skill, this will be associated with it.

name: Stunned
text: (condition) Your action must be to stand ground. Resolved aeor.

name: Summon
text: This creates a new character. The spell isn't channelled, but you may have only one summon spell active at a time, so if you re-cast, the current one is cancelled and any summons are dismissed: they cease to exist. The summoner can give orders to the summon, but doesn't control it directly, and it can act of its own initiative. If this would be incapacitated, instead it is dismissed.

name: Suppress
text: When you win an engagement from range, you may prevent the opponent from closing to melee.

name: Thrown
text: As for Consumed, but can be retrieved after.

name: Trap
text: No mechanical effect, but this is often used as a trap.

name: .*Tribal.*
text: No mechanical effect, but it probably synergises with other effects with the same tribe.

name: Two-handed
text: If you use this, you can't hold anything in your off hand, including anything @worn@ there. Take -1 athletics and -1 stealth while carrying this.

name: Unbridled
text: You can't deliberately weaken this spell.

name: Unseeing
text: This permanently has @Blind@ 10.

name: Veil
text: A magical effect that interferes with others' perception of an object or area. Anything veiled is hidden with +5 to stealth. When you know a veil is there, you can see through it, and also point it out to allies; if you don't know but strongly suspect, it doesn't get the +5 bonus. Veils can't hide magic signatures or touch, so if you cast or attack from behind one, you are revealed. They only scramble certain senses, so eg if you talk from behind a non-audio veil, that will reveal it.

name: Wild
text: You can try to tame this. See the miscellaneous mechanics page.

name: World-building
text: This content exists for world-building purposes, but is not available to players.

name: Worn.*
text: This is worn on the listed location. You can only have one item worn there.

name: Armour
text: Take +n to combat, -n to athletics, and -n to stealth.

name: Armour piercing
text: Take +n to combat up to a maximum of the target's total Armour value. Take -1 athletics while carrying this.

name: Blind
text: (condition) Take -$n to vigilance and to fight.

name: Burn
text: (condition) Convert this to Injury aeoc. Medical: Check MET+knowledge vs 15; on a pass, halve $n, rounding it up. Either way, it is immediately converted to Injury.

name: Dazzle
text: (condition) This counts as blind $n, maxing. Decrease this by 1 aeor unless you gain this this round.

name: Dim
text: Within $n metres, +1 light level (ie dark to dim or dim to normal). Multiple instances max.

name: Fatigue
text: (condition) Take -$n to all physical actions. Remove 3 with a long rest. At END+5 fatigue, you are Incapacitated.

name: Goop
text: (condition) Take -$n to athletics and melee combat. Decrease this by 1 aeor unless you gain this this round.

name: Injury
text: (condition) Take -$n to all physical actions. Medical: Check MET+knowledge vs 15; on a fail, take 2 @fatigue@ and you don't recover any fatigue today. Either way, remove 1 Injury. Can only be tried once per long rest.

name: Light
text: Within $n metres, +2 light levels (ie it becomes normally bright), and within another $n, +1. Multiple instances max.

name: Mana shock
text: (condition) Take -$n to magic. Decrease by 1 with each long rest. At END+5 mana shock, you can't cast spells or sense magic.

name: Nullify
text: Anything using magic within melee range not tagged Nullify takes -$n, and a -1 magic token aeor. Multiple instances max. This affects magic items. This is always visible to anything with magic sense. Pure magic entities always take -$n.

name: Paralysis
text: (condition) Take -$n to all physical actions.

name: Tangle
text: (condition) Take -$n to all physical actions. You can't manoeuvre. You have Untangle (move): if engaged this round, you don't inflict damage on a win, and if you win all engagements, resolve this condition. Lasts 3 rounds.
